name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with the greatest extension.

**Note 2:** In-transit metastasis is coded in SEER Regional Nodes.
rows:
Localized

Confined to site of origin

Localized, NOS

Skin of scrotum:
    Lesion(s) confined to dermis 
    Subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis)

Confined to scrotum

Stated as T1, T2, or T3

Regional by direct extension only

Extension to:
    Adjacent tissue(s), NOS
    Connective tissue

    Adjacent organs/structures

Male genital organs:
     Penis
     Prostate
    Testis
    Sites in this scheme which are not the primary

Satellite nodule(s) or in transit metastasis, distance from primary tumor less than or equal to 2 cm or distance not stated WITHOUT regional lymph node involvement.  
    Includes cases with ITCs only and cases with regional lymph node involvement not stated 

OR

Described as tumor with satellite nodule(s), NOS WITHOUT regional lymph node involvement or regional lymph node involvement not stated

Stated as T4

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
